title: Untreated sewage causes beaches to shut
content: This video can not be playedBeaches across Sussex have closed due to untreated sewage being released into the sea.In Hastings people have been advised not to swim due to a pollution risk. Beaches in Bexhill and Normans Bay were also shut after "significant" electrical issues at a pumping station.A spokesperson for Southern Water said: "I apologise to residents of Bexhill and Normans Bay because this is not acceptable."
